intro: Hoya decipulae, commonly known as the "false wax plant," is a species of flowering plant in the family Apocynaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, including countries such as Thailand and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, waxy flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Hoya decipulae is a climbing or trailing plant that often grows on trees or shrubs. It is popular among succulent and tropical plant enthusiasts due to its ornamental value and relatively low maintenance requirements.
